001/*

006
007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker;
012
013/**
014   Create a solid model of a Sierpinski Triangle centered at the origin.
015<p>
016   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierpi%C5%84ski_triangle" target="_top">
017                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sierpi%C5%84ski_triangle</a>
018*/
019public class SierpinskiTriangle extends Model implements MeshMaker
020{
021   final int n;
022
023   /**
024      Create a Sierpinski Triangle centered at the origin
025      using seven recursive iterations.
026   */
027   public SierpinskiTriangle()
028   {
029      this(7);
030   }
031
032
033   /**
034      Create a Sierpinski Triangle centered at the origin
035      using {@code n} recursive iterations.
036
037      @param n  number of recursive iterations
038      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 0
039   */
040   public SierpinskiTriangle(final int n)
041   {
042      super(String.format("Sierpinski_Triangle(%d)", n));
043
044      if (n < 0)
045         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than or equal to 0");
046
047      this.n = n;
048
049      if (0 == n)
050      {
051         // Create an elquilateral triangle.
052        addVertex(new Vertex( 1.0,  0,     0),
053                  new Vertex(-0.5,  0.866, 0),
054                  new Vertex(-0.5, -0.866, 0));
055
056         // Create a triangle.
057         addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 2));
058      }
059      else
060      {
061         addNestedModel(subTriangles(n - 1,  0.5,   0),
062                        subTriangles(n - 1, -0.25,  0.433),
063                        subTriangles(n - 1, -0.25, -0.433));
064      }
065   }
066
067
068   /**
069      Recursive helper function.
070      <p>
071      This function builds the three sub models needed
072      for one recusive step.
073
074      @param n   number of recursive iterations
075      @param tX  translation in the x-direction
076      @param tY  translation in the y-direction
077      @return    {@link Model} holding sub tree of triangles
078   */
079   private Model subTriangles(final int n, final double tX, final double tY)
080   {
081      assert (n >= 0);
082
083      final Model model =
084         new Model("Sierpinski Triangle: level "+n+" ("+tX+", "+tY+")",
085                   Matrix.translate(tX, tY, 0)
086            .times(Matrix.scale(0.5, 0.5, 0.5)));
087
088      if (0 == n) // stop the recursion
089      {
090         // Create an elquilateral triangle.
091         model.addVertex(new Vertex( 1.0,  0,     0),
092                         new Vertex(-0.5,  0.866, 0),
093                         new Vertex(-0.5, -0.866, 0));
094
095         // Create a triangle.
096         model.addPrimitive(new Triangle(0, 1, 2));
097      }
098      else
099      {
100         model.addNestedModel(subTriangles(n - 1,  0.5,   0),
101                              subTriangles(n - 1, -0.25,  0.433),
102                              subTriangles(n - 1, -0.25, -0.433));
103      }
104      return model;
105   }
106
107
108
109   // Implement the MeshMaker interface (three methods).
110   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
111
112   @Override public int getVertCount() {return n;}
113
114   @Override
115   public SierpinskiTriangle remake(final int n, final int k)
116   {
117      final int newN;
118      if (n != this.n)
119         newN = n;
120      else
121         newN = k;
122      return new SierpinskiTriangle(newN);
123   }
124}//SierpinskiTriangle
